solution.text:
Area of cloth\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))+l),3)}}_\,cm^2\)
Area of cloth lost in stitching and wastage\(=_{l}_\,cm^2\)
Therefore, area of cloth available for making the hat\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))+l),3)}}_-_{l}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))),3)}}_\,cm^2\)
Therefore, CSA of hat\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))),3)}}_\,cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow \pi rl=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))),3)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow \pi \times _{j}_ \times l = _{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))),3)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow l=_{{trunc(((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5)),3)}}_\,cm\)
We know, \(l^2=r^2+h^2\)
\(\Rightarrow h=\sqrt{l^2-r^2}\)
\(\Rightarrow h=\sqrt{_{{trunc(((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5)),3)}}_^2-_{j}_^2}\)
\(\Rightarrow h=\sqrt{_{{k**2}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow h=_{k}_\,cm\)
Volume of the hat\(=\frac13 \pi r^2h\)
\(=\frac13 \pi \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{{trunc(((1/Decimal(3))*pi_val*j**2*k),3)}}_\,cm^3\)

content.text: Ahmed has a piece of cloth whose area is \(_{{trunc((pi_val*j*((j**2+k**2)**Decimal(0.5))+l),3)}}_\)sq.cm. He uses it to make a large conical hat of base radius \(_{j}_\) cm. Assuming that the stitching margins and wastage incurred is approximately \(_{l}_\) sq.cm, find the volume of the hat that can be made with it.
